decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly put powerful creatures into play by utilizing cards that allow for graveyard recursion and card draw. By combining reanimation spells like Unearth and Persist with strong creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with threats early in the game. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help control the board while Faithless Looting and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and digging for combo pieces. The deck's strategy revolves around assembling the right combination of cards to execute its game plan efficiently.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose to cast spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to create a storm of spells. By chaining together spells and using the red mana efficiently, the deck aims to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent quickly, often winning the game in a single turn. The deck includes cards like Strike It Rich and Wish to help facilitate the combo and dig for important pieces like Grapeshot.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly play big Eldrazi creatures and overwhelm your opponent with their powerful abilities and high attack power. With cards like Devourer of Destiny, Glaring Fleshraker, and It That Heralds the End, you can put pressure on your opponent early in the game. Utilize cards like Kozilek's Command and Ugin's Labyrinth to control the board and maintain your advantage. The deck also includes various lands and support cards to ensure you can consistently play your Eldrazi creatures and win the match.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo utilizing Puresteel Paladin, Colossus Hammer, and Leyline Axe to create a massive threat in a short amount of time. Urza's Saga and Stoneforge Mystic help to search for the key pieces, while Mox Opal provides additional mana acceleration. The inclusion of battlefield improvisation and Arid Mesa adds consistency to the deck, allowing for swift and explosive plays. Inkmoth Nexus serves as an alternate win condition, providing additional pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game until it can establish its own win condition. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and protect its own spells. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to deal with a variety of threats. Overall, the deck excels at outlasting opponents and grinding out victories through careful resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Birthing Ritual and Shardless Agent to play powerful creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Abhorrent Oculus. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Negation and removal spells like Sink into Stupor. It also utilizes card draw and creature bounce effects to maintain card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of cards like Endurance and Harbinger of the Seas provides additional disruption and protection against various strategies. Overall, the deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays while controlling the board.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual to play powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategies with counterspells and removal spells. By using cards like Shardless Agent and Coiling Oracle, it aims to generate card advantage while maintaining a strong board presence. The versatility of cards like Fire / Ice and Flare of Denial allows for both aggressive plays and defensive strategies. The inclusion of creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Harbinger of the Seas provides additional control options while pressuring the opponent's life total.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to rapidly and aggressively play low-cost spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. Utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Slickshot Show-Off, the deck aims to have a fast and efficient start, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. With a mix of card advantage and direct damage, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize or mount a defense.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With efficient removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Ranger-Captain of Eos, along with protection from cards like Voice of Victory and Mana Tithe, the deck aims to maintain board control while dealing direct damage to the opponent. The addition of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provides additional versatility and support for the aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through a combination of creature pressure and burn spells.

The deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's strategy while deploying powerful creatures and controlling the board with removal spells and creature bounce. The deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total quickly while creating difficult board states through a combination of disruptive spells and powerful threats. The deck utilizes a mix of white and red creatures and spells to control the game and come out ahead in the mid to late game with efficient removal and hard-to-answer threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to quickly assemble powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Ghalta, and Ureni. By using cards such as Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer for protection, along with Consign to Memory for utility, the deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn through a powerful combo. The inclusion of Xenagos, God of Revels and Planar Genesis helps ensure a successful setup for the combo while maintaining consistency and resilience against disruption.

This deck revolves around using various spells and abilities to create a powerful combo without relying on lands. It includes cards that help search for combo pieces, protect against disruption, and control the opponent's board. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent before they can respond. The main win condition is to use Goblin Charbelcher to deal lethal damage, supported by cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Thundertrap Trainer. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, consistent, and disruptive in order to secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, you can quickly establish a threatening board presence. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory allow you to control the game and disrupt your opponent's strategy. Quantum Riddler and Prismatic Ending help deal with threats on the board. The deck also has a small land destruction package with cards like Arena of Glory and Wrath of the Skies to further disrupt your opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game by playing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and utilizing efficient removal spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Solitude. It also disrupts the opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Quantum Riddler, while generating card advantage and flexibility through cards like Consign to Memory and Ephemerate. The deck is designed to control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and finish the game quickly with powerful threats like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury.

The key concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, Mine) to ramp up mana quickly and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes cards like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and Karn, the Great Creator for additional control and disruption. With a mix of removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for a powerful late-game win condition.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast big spells and play Primeval Titan to search for lands that generate even more mana. The goal is to set up a combination of Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands to generate massive amounts of mana and cast game-ending spells like Scapeshift. The deck also includes versatile lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field to provide additional utility and options for winning the game. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with explosive plays and powerful combos.
